intro: Lyonia jamaicensis var. myrsinifolia, commonly known as Jamaican lyonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a glossy surface. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in the spring. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds.
